Articles.Content: 0.20, I think.
Demo 0.18, then 0.18 and so on!
.19.1, still feeling that I am the newest player.
0.18 and in a couple of weeks i will have closed a year playing KSP
Technically I started with the 0.13.3 demo and played that for half a year, but I bought the game at 0.16.
I joined in .18.4, when docking ports where first introduced.
Very first (public) iteration of the game, Was relatively active in the forums in they days of Sunday punch and having no runways but ive been playing constantly

Back a bit over two years ago when .10 came out. It's been so awesome watching KSP evolve, more and more features getting checked off the list, mod authors come and go (I always hoped wolf's pack of parts would come back), and the game get WAY more popular.

I'm sure anybody who played back before the map view and even time warp can attest to the fact that KSP played differently before then. Much more math, and guessing, and waiting, when you only had the three basic instruments to rely on. I remember how excited I got when I was waiting half an hour to check the vertical velocity at the apopoapsis/periapsis and verify that I was actually in orbit. It was the best feeling ever.
I joined way back in 0.14.4 after watching some Kurtjmac videos. When I joined I thought I was already late to the party but looking at that graphy I feel kind of old now.

Damn, mis-clicked. I feel like an idiot now.

Anyway, I joined in the good ol' days of 0.14.x (it was a while back but I think it was 0.14.2 if that was a thing. I definitely had it for 0.14.4., maybe even as far back as 0.12, I can't remeber at all ) It was approximately 3 months before Kurtjmac started making videos on it. Again, a while back so that might be inaccurate.

Edited February 12, 2014 by Shna_na

.17 i think, the second demo. i think i saw an article in PC Gamer while at the bookstore, made a note in my phone and checked it out when i got home. played the demo for about 15mins before i threw money at squad to get the full game. then got two friends to buy it.

I was bored on YouTube one day, and I was watching a video by chickenkeeper when I noticed a strange video by him had popped up in the right side thingy, it was one of his Kerbal space program videos, and as soon as I got halfway through the video, provided it was from like around maybe .13 or so, I knew it was the game I'd always wanted, and I immediately downloaded the demo, and as my first rocket exploded with Jeb laughing whilst bill and bob screamed, I knew I had to get the full version immediately, I managed to get to the mun in a massive rocket, without any real stages, and I was stupid enough to try and land it XD I joined the forums the same day, which was febuary 15
.17 - I still think .18 was one of the best updates ever for the game, hopefully it is trumped by the awesomeness that .24 could be!

0.22.

I wish I had joined earlier, I lost all of the fun you all had.

Very late .17, in fact the servers were thoroughly borked by the swarm of people updating to .18, which i got a day or so later and really annoyed me by nerfing the aerospike and making some of my best rockets kinda crappy or unable to lift off.
I started in 0.23
I started in 0.18 and am still using my original save! (yes I've upgraded to .23)

I joined in very late 0.15, 0.16 came out a few weeks later.

Around 0.17 i started lurking around here as a guest and joined the forum in either late 0.17 or 0.18 only to have my account die in The Great Forum Massacre Of April 2013

I mourned my account for 4 months before finally rejoining because the science update had so much hype that i wanted to join the community again so i could enjoy that hype with everyone else.

Edited February 20, 2014 by Astronaut
Sometime after the Great Kracken ate the forums and at 23rd April 2013. =^.^=
I joined in 13.3 I believe. I didn't land on the Mun until we had legs, but I sure hit it hard trying.
I first played KSP in version 0.8.5 and joined the forums in around 0.11.
A friend got me interested during the early days (somewhere between 0.7.3 and 0.10), and it totally hooked me up. I even managed to get to the MÃƒÂ¼n a few times when it still was a flat ball!
I think it was 0.10... made a preorder almost immediately - that's how it catched me
>obligatory "back in my day..." post
0.18. Best money I ever spent on a game.
